body: This interacts badly with the music player, which allows you to control the shellmap music but otherwise shows an empty list in TD if you don't have scores.mix installed.

Crash when starting a skirmish in TD with transit.mix but not scores.mix:

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Sequence contains no elements
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.First[TSource] (IEnumerable`1 source) [0x00067] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-crypto-32/bockbuild-xamarin/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-4.3.0/external/referencesource/System.Core/System/Linq/Enumerable.cs:930 
  at OpenRA.Traits.MusicPlaylist..ctor (OpenRA.World world, OpenRA.Traits.MusicPlaylistInfo info) [0x00158] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Traits/World/MusicPlaylist.cs:75 
  at OpenRA.Traits.MusicPlaylistInfo.Create (OpenRA.ActorInitializer init) [0x00008] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Traits/World/MusicPlaylist.cs:38 
  at OpenRA.Actor..ctor (OpenRA.World world, System.String name, OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary initDict) [0x000c8] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Actor.cs:95 
  at OpenRA.World.CreateActor (Boolean addToWorld, System.String name, OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary initDict) [0x00004] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//World.cs:245

  at OpenRA.Game.StartGame (System.String mapUID, WorldType type) [0x00074] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:150 
  at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager, OpenRA.World world, Int32 clientId, OpenRA.Order order) [0x004da] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Network/UnitOrders.cs:110 
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate () [0x00119] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Network/OrderManager.cs:130 
  at OpenRA.Sync+<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 () [0x00007] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Sync.cs:168 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1 fn) [0x00008] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Sync.cs:176 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged (OpenRA.World world, System.Action fn) [0x0001b] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Sync.cs:168 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x0011c] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:462 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x0004e] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:507 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x000d4] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:631 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00042] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:671 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:111 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00050] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:39 
```

why do we want this?

> why do we want this?

in TD you have the shellmap theme, and a short "win" jingle which would eventually play if you set the background music to random

I didn't intend for you to start on the ambient music fixes here (my initial comment was an observation, not a request!), but since you've started then let's get it right here.

The idea is that this is completely separate to the StartingMusic, and defines what should be played in the absence of any other music.  It doesn't make sense to have a lua API to actively play an ambient track, and you definitely don't want outside code directly manipulating the playlists IsCurrentSongAmbient property.  The ambient track is then played automatically when the stop function is called, or via the song completed handler if there isn't a new song to queue up.

The public API for this (both to code and to lua) should be a SetAmbientSong method, which then sets the the internal reference for the ambient track, and changes the song only if the (old) ambient track is already playing.  If code wants to set a new ambient track and then force it to play it should call playlist.SetAmbientSong and then playlist.Stop().
How would the game know which song is the ambient track?
Via the `AmbientMusic` property or the Lua API.
So that would be in MusicInfo?
`MusicPlaylist`.  I expect these tracks would then also have `Hidden: true` in the music info.
I've implemented the background music concept in #8876.  Once that's merged we can rebase this on top for the hidden songs flag.
I've folded the changes from here into #8876 so that can fix everything in one go.
